column1: If set yo yes, will display potential error messages in frontend.
column2: If set yo yes, will display potential error messages in frontend.

column1: Also known as "Did you mean?" feature. If set to yes, will display a suggestion if search engine detects a better text query.
column2: Also known as "Did you mean?" feature. If set to yes, will display a suggestion if search engine detects a better text query.

column1: host:port separated by comma. Follow this pattern for full available parameters: http://php.net/manual/en/function.parse-url.php
column2: host:port separated by comma. Follow this pattern for full available parameters: http://php.net/manual/en/function.parse-url.php

column1: Only used for https connection. Useful to set No here if you don't have a valid SSL certificate.
column2: Only used for https connection. Useful to set No here if you don't have a valid SSL certificate.

column1: Number of seconds after a timeout occurs for every request. If using indexing of file, large value necessary.
column2: Number of seconds after a timeout occurs for every request. If using indexing of file, large value necessary.

column1: Used to prefix index names to avoid potential collisions.
column2: Used to prefix index names to avoid potential collisions.

column1: Having more shards enhances the indexing performance and allows to distribute a big index across machines.
column2: Having more shards enhances the indexing performance and allows to distribute a big index across machines.

column1:
The number of replicas each shard has. Having more replicas enhances the search performance and improves the cluster availability.
Be careful when modifying this parameter. Write consistency (one, quorum or all) must be considered in order to avoid timeout write action. More info here: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/docs-bulk.html#bulk-consistency and here https://github.com/elasticsearch/elasticsearch/issues/444
column2:
The number of replicas each shard has. Having more replicas enhances the search performance and improves the cluster availability.
Be careful when modifying this parameter. Write consistency (one, quorum or all) must be considered in order to avoid timeout write action. More info here: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/docs-bulk.html#bulk-consistency and here https://github.com/elasticsearch/elasticsearch/issues/444

column1:
Default write consistency is quorum (active shards > replicas / 2 + 1).
For example, in a N shards with 2 replicas index, there will have to be at least 2 active shards within the relevant partition (quorum) for the operation to succeed. In a N shards with 1 replica scenario, there will need to be a single shard active (in this case, one and quorum is the same).
column2:
Default write consistency is quorum (active shards > replicas / 2 + 1).
For example, in a N shards with 2 replicas index, there will have to be at least 2 active shards within the relevant partition (quorum) for the operation to succeed. In a N shards with 1 replica scenario, there will need to be a single shard active (in this case, one and quorum is the same).

column1: Reindex in a temporary index and switch to it once finished. Especially useful for large product catalogs.
column2: Reindex in a temporary index and switch to it once finished. Especially useful for large product catalogs.

column1: For example, with the OR operator, the query "digital camera" is translated to "digital OR camera", with the AND operator, the same query is translated to "digital AND camera". The default value is AND.
column2: For example, with the OR operator, the query "digital camera" is translated to "digital OR camera", with the AND operator, the same query is translated to "digital AND camera". The default value is AND.

column1: Should we store source data in Elasticsearch or not. Keep this setting to No for better performances. Will be forced to Yes if fast autocomplete is enabled.
column2: Should we store source data in Elasticsearch or not. Keep this setting to No for better performances. Will be forced to Yes if fast autocomplete is enabled.

column1: If enabled, will override default autocomplete to display products directly.
column2: If enabled, will override default autocomplete to display products directly.

column1: Limit the number of results in autocompletion for each entity.
column2: Limit the number of results in autocompletion.

column1: Image size in px, default is 50px.
column2: Image size in px, default is 50px.

column1: If enabled, catagories will be indexed in Elasticsearch.
column2: If enabled, catagories will be indexed in Elasticsearch.

column1: If enabled, categories will also be searchable in autocomplete box.
column2: If enabled, categories will also be searchable in autocomplete box.

column1: If enabled, categories will also be displayed in right column of search results page.
column2: If enabled, categories will also be displayed in right column of search results page.

column1: If enabled, CMS pages will be indexed in Elasticsearch.
column2: If enabled, CMS pages will be indexed in Elasticsearch.

column1: If enabled, CMS pages will also be searchable in autocomplete box.
column2: If enabled, CMS pages will also be searchable in autocomplete box.

column1: If enabled, CMS pages will also be displayed in right column of search results page.
column2: If enabled, CMS pages will also be displayed in right column of search results page.

column1: Rebuild CMS pages fulltext search index
column2: Rebuild CMS pages fulltext search index

column1: Boost some attributes by giving them a higher weight.
column2: Boost some attributes by giving them a higher weight.

column1: If enabled, a custom response header will be present for debug purpose.
column2: If enabled, a custom response header will be present for debug purpose.

column1: If only 1 result matches the query, the user will be redirected to the product page automatically.
column2: If only 1 result matches the query, the user will be redirected to the product page automatically.

column1: Limit number of results. Zero or empty means unlimited.
column2: Limit number of results. Zero or empty means unlimited.

column1: If enabled, category path will be displayed in search results.
column2: If enabled, category path will be displayed in search results.

column1: Selected CMS pages will be excluded from search.
column2: Selected CMS pages will be excluded from search.
